title: Sources: Seahawks unlikely to use tags on Walker
content: The Seahawks are unlikely to use either a franchise or transition tag on running back and Super Bowl MVP Kenneth Walker III, league sources told ESPN.

title: Heise 3 lifts ISU hours after sister scores for U.S.
content: Hours after sister Taylor Heise scored to help the U.S. women's Olympic hockey team beat Sweden 5-0 in Milan, Nate Heise hit a go-ahead 3-pointer in No. 6 Iowa State's thrilling 70-67 victory over Big 12 leader and second-ranked Houston on Monday night.

title: Hill, cut by Fins, vows 'the Cheetah will be back'
content: The Dolphins released Tyreek Hill in a flurry of roster moves that will clear significant salary cap space.

title: USA's Meyers Taylor, 41, wins 1st Olympic gold
content: The United States' Elana Meyers Taylor won the women's monobob title Monday to win her first Olympic gold medal at age 41.

title: U.S. women's hockey to face Canada in final
content: The Americans continued their dominant run through the women's hockey tournament, routing Sweden 5-0 to reach the gold medal game vs. Canada.

title: Shooting at R.I. rink leaves 3 dead, teams fleeing
content: A shooting inside a Rhode Island hockey rink Monday left three people dead, several others injured and the two high school teams playing fleeing the ice as it all unfolded.

title: L.A. mayor calls for '28 Olympics head to resign
content: The mayor of L.A. has called for Casey Wasserman to resign as head of the 2028 Olympics organizing team because of his ties to Jeffrey Epstein's former girlfriend.

title: Judge: Frustrated by slow start to Yanks' winter
content: Aaron Judge said the start of the Yankees' offseason was "frustrating" but believes the team is in a better spot now.

title: 50 top free agents, 50 perfect NFL team fits: We picked where each player should sign in March
content: Which team makes the most sense for Alec Pierce? Where do Malik Willis and the QBs fit best? And where could defensive standouts excel?

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: 'Blade Angels' take the ice, American teens in snowboard final and more
content: Tuesday at the Winter Olympics is headlined by Alysa Liu, Amber Glenn and Isabeau Levito in the women's figure skating short program.

title: The improbable comeback of Alysa Liu
content: After retiring from figure skating at 16, Alysa Liu returned on her own terms, with her own quirky style. And she's an Olympic gold medal favorite.

title: Why the Lakers' quiet trade deadline could make for an explosive offseason
content: With LeBron James' uncertain future, draft assets and significant cap space this summer, the Lakers are set up to be a major offseason player -- and maybe even try to land Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: The ultimate debate: Skubal or Skenes? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 starting pitchers in MLB
content: We break down the best players at every spot on the diamond entering 2026, starting with a star-studded position featuring two of baseball's biggest stars.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Michigan is the new No. 1
content: After nine straight weeks at the top, the Wildcats fall after back-to-back losses, making way for the Wolverines.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Duke into top 10, Georgia returns, Minnesota debuts
content: The top five stayed the same, Duke entered the top 10, and Maryland and TCU were the biggest climbers.

title: From Arsenal to FK Qarabag: Why every team left will, won't win the Champions League
content: For each of the 24 remaining teams with a shot at the Champions League crown, let's talk about both why they could win the whole thing ... and why they probably won't.

title: Ronaldo's next opponents have never lost a domestic match. Wait, what?
content: Which team has won every domestic match in its history? Which champions aren't based in the same country as their league? Here are football's unheralded powerhouses.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: Awa Fam, Olivia Miles, Lauren Betts and Flau'jae Johnson follow Fudd, the projected top pick in April's draft.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer-beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye shock move for Liverpool's Mac Allister
content: Manchester United are considering a shock move for Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: 7-Year-Old Andhra Girl's Body Found In Drum. CCTV Shows Killer Walking With Her
content: A search for a missing seven-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh's Annamayya district ended in horror when police discovered her body hidden inside a drum.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What ChatGPT Is Now Doing With Your Darkest 'Secrets'
content: For over three years now, millions across the world have treated ChatGPT like a confidante. And one company - OpenAI - holds the keys to this vast digital locker.

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw Apologises After AI Summit Crowding Complaints
content: Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister of Electronics and Information Technology, apologised on Tuesday to visitors to a global artificial intelligence summit who had complained of overcrowding and other organisational problems on the first day.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026: Decoding India's AI Growth Strategy
content: After a high-energy kick-off yesterday, the India AI Impact Summit 2026 is currently moving into its second day of shaping the global conversation on artificial intelligence.

title: Under 1% Reach 100-Day Goal Under MNREGA In Madhya Pradesh In 6 Years
content: A major political storm has erupted in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly after data revealed that not even one percent of registered labourers received the full 100 days of guaranteed employment under MNREGA in the last six years.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026 Day 2 LIVE Updates: Applied AI And Social Equity Key Themes
content: India AI Impact Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: The summit at Delhi's Bharat Mandapamwill enter its second day on Tuesday, a day afterPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the expo featuring 600 startups and 13 country pavillions.

title: PM Modi Announces Special Global Strategic Partnership Between India, France
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who met French President Emmanuel Macron today, announced a "Special Global Strategic Partnership" between India and France.

title: 30 Minutes, 3 Warnings: Khamenei Targets Trump As US-Iran Talks Begin
content: Ahead of the US-Iran talks, Trump said he believed Iran was interested in reaching an agreement. However, recent statements by Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei have taken a different tone.

title: Teen Who Killed Delhi Biker Told Cops He Was 19, Birth Certificate Reveals Lie
content: The birth certificate shows the teenager, who was driving the Scorpio that rammed Sahil Dhaneshra's bike, was born on August 2, 2009.

title: "Mercy vs Mankind": Top Court Flags Perils Of AI Use In Drafting Petitions
content: The Supreme Court today flagged an "alarming" trend of lawyers using Artificial Intelligence tools to draft petitions, leading to errors and inaccuracies.

title: Who Is Vevek Agrawal? Haldiram Scion Who Tied Knot In Lavish Nagpur Wedding
content: Vevek Agrawal, son of Haldiram Group'sKamal Agrawal, married executive Kenisha Paliwal in a high-profile ceremony in Nagpur.

title: Tarique Rahman Takes Oath As Bangladesh PM After BNP's Landslide Win
content: Rahman, who was in self-imposed exile in London for 17 years, had returned to Bangladesh in December following the death of his mother, Khaleda Zia

title: "Accused In Their 60s, 70s, 80s": Supreme Court On CBI's Appeal Against Bail To Lalu Yadav
content: Pointing to the ages of the accused - who are in their 60s, 70s, 80s - the Supreme Court on Tuesday adjourned to April 22 the hearing on a plea filed by the CBI, challenging the bail granted by the Jharkhand High Court to Lalu Yadav in treasury scam.

title: Iran Fires Missiles At Strait Of Hormuz As Nuclear Talks With US Begin
content: The US and Iran are holding their second round of talks about Iran's nuclear program Tuesday in Geneva as the United States ramps up its military presence in the Middle East and Iran holds large-scale maritime exercises.

title: "Lot Of Amazing Ideas": Peter Steinberger, OpenClaw's Creator, Joins OpenAI
content: Austrian software developer Peter Steinberger, the creator of OpenClaw, an open-source AI agent framework, is set to join OpenAI.

title: Tarique Rahman's Oath-Taking Ceremony Live: Tarique Rahman Takes Oath As Bangladesh's New Prime Minister
content: Tarique Rahman's oath ceremony in Bangladesh: BNP has bagged 209 out of 297 seats, while right-wing Jamaat-e-Islami secured 68 seats in the 13th parliamentary elections.

title: Man, 70, Dies After Being Allegedly Assaulted By Son In Bengaluru
content: A 70-year-old man died in Bengaluru after being allegedly assaulted by his son over property and family disputes.

title: "Selective": Court Seeks Change To Plea On BJP Chief Ministers' Hate Speech
content: Flagging "selective" selection of three Chief Ministers, the Supreme Court today refused to hear a petition for strict guidelines against hate speech by people in high constitutional posts

title: Macron Meets PM Modi: AI Summit, Potential Rafale Contract On Agenda
content: French President Emmanuel Macron met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai on Tuesday, as he begins a three-day visit to India focused on artificial intelligence cooperation and a potential multibillion dollar fighter jet deal.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'Team Rahul' And 'Team Priyanka': Inside Congress' Plans For Kerala And Assam
content: The two siblings don't function at cross-purposes or differ on key ideological issues. However, in practice, they are often seen following slightly different 'chaal, chalan, chehra', as they say, from each other.

title: Om Birla meets new Bangladesh PM Tarique Rahman, hands over PM Modi’s letter
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla represented India at the swearing-in of Bangladesh's new Prime Minister Tarique Rahman. He conveyed a personal congratulatory letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Rahman, son of former PM Khaleda Zia, took oath after a period of political uncertainty. This marks a new chapter for Bangladesh following the interim government's tenure.

title: PM Modi calls France 'special partner', H125 chopper assembly line launched
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French president Emmanuel Macron virtually inaugurated assembly line for production of Airbus H125 helicopters at Vemagal in Karnataka. The H125 Light Utility Helicopter Final Assembly Line at Vemagal is expected to strengthen India's indigenous aerospace manufacturing capabilities and further deepen India-France defence and industrial cooperation. Before the media briefing in Mumbai, PM Modi held comprehensive talks with Macron.

title: Shoaib Akhtar takes 360-degree U-turn after calling Mohsin Naqvi 'illiterate'
content: Shoaib Akhtar's sharp criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi took a U-turn, with the former pacer claiming his remarks were misconstrued.  Akhtar insisted his 'incompetent and illiterate' comments targeted broader administration issues, not Naqvi personally. He expressed frustration over the India boycott stance flip-flop, while also critiquing player selections and Pakistan's overall cricketing approach.

title: US' biggest investor’s 'joker message' for those saying Anthropic can do IT jobs
content: Renowned investor Jim Cramer expressed skepticism about major law firms entrusting high-stakes client work to AI, questioning the current reliability of tools like Anthropic's Claude.  His comments follow a significant market downturn in software and tech stocks, triggered by the launch of AI plugins that analysts dubbed a 'SaaSpocalypse'.

title: Pakistan's problem isn't about skill or temperament — it runs much deeper
content: Pakistan’s recurring struggles against India are not rooted in nerves or talent but in a persistent lack of role clarity. Frequent chopping and changing, confused player roles and an overreliance on all-rounders have left the side without balance or a Plan B. As pressure mounts on senior players, Pakistan’s deeper structural issues continue to surface on the biggest stage.

title: 'I was sold 30 years ago': Paperless Sonagachhi sex worker tells EC amid SIR row
content: Sex workers in Kolkata's Sonagachhi faced hurdles proving their identity for voter registration, with many lacking historical documents due to past circumstances like being sold. A special Election Commission hearing highlighted their plight, as they struggled to recall or provide proof of family roots. Officials acknowledged the difficulty in obtaining past records for individuals whose lives began in obscurity.

title: 'Chinese Robots' at Lunar Year event impress & 'prove' why Musk says China is 'big' rival
content: China's CCTV Spring Festival Gala showcased domestic humanoid robots, highlighting the nation's ambition in robotics and manufacturing. This demonstration aligns with Elon Musk's prediction of China becoming a major competitor in the humanoid robot market, as Chinese startups prepare for IPOs and release advanced AI models.

title: Zimbabwe create history, storm into Super Eight; Australia eliminated from T20 World Cup
content: Persistent rain washed out the Zimbabwe vs Ireland match, confirming Zimbabwe's Super 8 qualification and eliminating Australia. The abandoned fixture led to a points split, finalising the Super 8 Group G1 lineup with India, South Africa, West Indies, and Zimbabwe.

title: 'Warship can be sent to sea floor': Khamenei's blunt warning to Trump, US
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued direct threats against President Trump and the US, warning that even the strongest military can be struck down. He highlighted Iran's capability to sink US warships and asserted that America will fail to eliminate the Islamic Republic, despite ongoing tensions and US surveillance efforts.

title: 'Imran Khan deserves dignity': 14 ex-captains write to Pak govt - full list
content: Indian cricket legends Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, alongside 12 other former international captains, have voiced grave concerns over Imran Khan's health in jail. They've appealed to Pakistan's government for adequate medical care and dignified treatment for the jailed cricketer-turned-politician, citing reports of significant vision loss due to alleged neglect.

title: Who is Elana Meyers Taylor’s husband Nic Taylor? Inside their story
content: American bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor created history at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics on February 16. The 41-year-old won the women’s monobob and secured her first Olympic gold medal. It was the sixth Olympic medal of her career. The achievement tied her with speed skating legend Bonnie Blair for the most Winter Olympic medals by an American woman.

title: 'Tughlaqi Commission' working on BJP's behest: Mamata sharpens SIR attack on EC
content: Mamata also made an explosive claim amid the ongoing SIR in the poll-bound West Bengal, saying a woman functionary in the BJP IT cell "removed 58 lakh voters’ names in Bengal using AI". The TMC chief said in Bengal, "160 people lost their lives due to SIR anxiety, work-related pressure". Mamata said if the election commission "penalises" Bengal government officers, her government would "100 per cent protect them".

title: Tarique Rahman sworn in as Bangladesh Prime Minister
content: Tarique Rahman has been sworn in as Bangladesh's new Prime Minister, marking a significant shift after decades of female leadership. Son of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, Rahman returns from exile to lead the nation following the BNP's landslide victory in the recent general elections. His appointment signals a new era for Bangladesh's political landscape.

title: Amid no-handshake row, Rohit Sharma's hug with Wasim Akram goes viral in Colombo - watch
content: Rohit Sharma and Wasim Akram's warm hug before the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash stole the show, contrasting with the on-field no-handshake policy.  Despite pre-match camaraderie, India dominated the game, crushing Pakistan by 61 runs thanks to Ishan Kishan's 77 and stellar bowling performances, securing their Super Eight spot.

title: Stock market: Here are the top gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today - check list
content: Indian equity benchmarks concluded Tuesday higher for a second day, propelled by gains in banking, IT, and capital goods sectors. The BSE Sensex rose 173.81 points to 83,450.96, while the NSE Nifty climbed 42.65 points to 25,725.40.  IT stocks continued their recovery, supported by strategic AI collaborations, while defence stocks also saw an uptick.

title: Tanmaya Shekhar on self-marketing Nukkad Naatak - Exclusive
content: Debut independent filmmaker Tanmaya Shekhar is releasing his film 'Nukkad Naatak' this February, starring Molshri and Shivang Rajpal.  The movie explores the stark differences between two close-knit worlds, using the creative medium of street theatre to address education and LGBTQ+ issues.  Shekhar and his team are self-distributing and marketing the film, traveling extensively to connect with audiences directly.

title: Pakistan: At least 17 killed in two bomb attacks, gunfight
content: A suicide bombing and attack by gunmen on a security post in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province resulted in the deaths of 11 soldiers and a child. Security forces thwarted the overnight breach attempt, later killing 12 TTP militants. The explosives-laden vehicle also damaged civilian homes, injuring seven others.

title: NGT clears Rs 90K-cr Great Nicobar project, why it's a game changer
content: The National Green Tribunal has approved the Rs 90,000-crore Great Nicobar infrastructure project, finding sufficient environmental safeguards. Dismissing petitions challenging the clearance, the tribunal noted that a high-powered committee addressed outstanding concerns. The project, crucial for national security and India's Indian Ocean presence, will proceed with strict adherence to environmental conditions.

title: Salman Khan's father Salim Khan diagonsed with a blood clot: Report
content: Veteran screenwriter Salim Khan was admitted to Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai after feeling unwell. He was reportedly taken to the ICU, with family members including Salman Khan present. Latest reports indicate he has been diagnosed with a blood clot and his vital signs are stable. Further updates are awaited.

title: Ramadan moon sighted in Saudi Arabia? KSA SC calls Muslims to spot crescent on Feb 17
content: Muslims worldwide are anticipating the crescent moon sighting tonight, February 17, 2026, to mark the beginning of Ramadan 1447 AH. Saudi authorities are urging citizens to report any sightings. If confirmed, fasting begins Wednesday, February 18. Otherwise, it starts Thursday, February 19. This tradition blends science and faith, setting the rhythm for prayer and community.

title: Female traveller shares her India experience
content: A parent, after 16 years abroad, returned to India with children, expecting nostalgia but finding a stark realization: India is no longer home. Daily life, from social behavior and traffic to food and systems, felt jarring, highlighting a significant personal evolution and a values mismatch, leaving them with unexpected clarity.

title: 'Next time we'll put up a better show': Tariq breaks silence after defeat to India
content: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq remains optimistic about the team's T20 World Cup chances despite a crushing loss to India. He believes the side has learned from mistakes and is determined to defeat Namibia to advance. Tariq also defended underperforming stars Babar Azam and Shaheen Shah Afridi, emphasizing their past contributions and the team's ultimate goal of winning the tournament.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Damaged black box slows probe; AAIB seeks US help
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau is seeking specialized US assistance to retrieve data from the Cockpit Voice Recorder of a Learjet 45 that crashed near Baramati, killing five, including Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar. While the Digital Flight Data Recorder has been successfully downloaded, the CVR sustained fire damage.

title: US civil rights leader Jesse Jackson dies at 84
content: Civil rights icon Rev. Jesse L. Jackson, a close associate of Martin Luther King Jr., has died at 84 after battling Parkinson's and progressive supranuclear palsy. Jackson, a two-time presidential candidate, dedicated over five decades to fighting for voting rights, jobs, education, and racial equality, founding Operation PUSH and the Rainbow/PUSH Coalition.

title: Chris Jones wants released Tyreek Hill back with Chiefs
content: Kansas City Chiefs’ veteran defensive tackle Chris Jones has publicly sent out a signal to former teammate, close friend, and draft buddy Tyreek Hill to return home. Hill, an unrestricted free agent after being recently released by the Miami Dolphins, is recovering from a dislocated knee and torn ligaments, with a projected return by the start of the 2026 season. A reunion with his parent franchise would make a perfect script for his football comeback.

title: Heartwarming moment in Japan zoo: Baby macaque abandoned by his mother, finds comfort in a toy
content: A tiny macaque named Punch, abandoned at birth, found solace in a plush toy at Japan's Ichikawa City Zoo.  Hand-raised by zookeepers, the six-month-old's bond with his orangutan companion has captivated millions online.  This touching story highlights the universal need for comfort and connection, as Punch gradually integrates with his troop, still clutching his beloved toy.

title: Delhi University bans protests for a month after backlash over UGC equity norms
content: Delhi University has banned all gatherings, processions, and protests on its campuses for one month due to law and order concerns. This decision follows clashes between student groups over the now-stayed UGC equity guidelines. The university cited potential obstruction of traffic, threats to life, and disturbances to public peace as reasons for the prohibition.

title: Prathyusha death case: SC restores 5-year jail term after 24-year fight
content: The Supreme Court has restored a five-year jail term for Siddharth Reddy in the Prathyusha death case, concluding a 24-year legal battle. The apex court rejected Reddy's plea against his conviction for abetting the actress's suicide, upholding the trial court's original sentence after her mother's persistent pursuit of justice.

title: 'PR hungry': Cong slams Centre over 'utter chaos' at AI Impact Summit; Vaishnaw replies
content: The Congress party has criticized the Centre's alleged mismanagement of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, calling it an example of a "PR hungry" government that turned a global opportunity into "utter chaos." Party president Mallikarjun Kharge highlighted distress faced by participants, including founders, exhibitors, and visitors, due to logistical failures and disruptions.

title: Auto wholesale growth to normalise at 3–6% in FY27 after strong H2 recovery: Report
content: Indian auto sector anticipates moderate growth in 2026-27, with passenger vehicles expected to rise 4-6%. Two-wheelers will see a slowdown after recovery, while commercial vehicles will be led by buses. Electrification is identified as a significant long-term trend shaping the industry's future amidst evolving consumer choices.

title: 'Messy, risky, dangerous': EAM Jaishankar says global order heading for 'twilight zone'
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar said that ​​economics will give way to politics and security "when it comes to making choices and technology in the age of AI will be even more transformative than ever before." The minister also highlighted how the world today has been witnessing "weaponisation of production, finance, leveraging of market shares and tightening of export controls".

title: ‘Treat Imran Khan fairly’: Gavaskar, Kapil Dev & 12 other captains write letter to Pak govt
content: Legendary cricketers from five countries, including Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, have appealed to the Pakistan government for proper treatment of jailed former captain Imran Khan. Citing his deteriorating health and vision loss, the appeal highlights Khan's cricketing achievements and former prime ministerial role, urging humane detention and medical care.

title: Who is Yuvraj Samra? Youngest centurion in T20 World Cup history
content: Yuvraj Samra made history at 19 years and 141 days, becoming the youngest centurion in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup with a brilliant 110 against New Zealand. His career-best knock, featuring 11 fours and 6 sixes, powered Canada to 173 and set a new record for the highest individual score by an Associate nation batter.

title: Assam approves 3% reservation for tea tribes, Adivasis in Grade 1 and 2 govt jobs
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma had announced a 3 per cent reservation for youths from tea gardens in Grade I and Grade II government jobs in October last year during the 19th biennial general conference of the Assam Tea Tribe Students’ Association (ATTSA) and the central biennial general conference of the Assam Tea Tribe Women’s Association.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K city-wise rates in Delhi, Mumbai & more
content: Gold prices saw a dip of over 1% in futures trade Tuesday, influenced by easing safe-haven demand, improved geopolitical sentiment, and a stronger US dollar. Analysts suggest this is a corrective phase within a broader bullish trend, with investors advised to rebalance on dips amid choppy markets. Global markets also experienced a decline in gold futures.

title: Dark clouds over Australia's campaign: What if rain washes out ZIM vs IRE in Pallekele?
content: Australia's World Cup hopes are in peril, needing Ireland to defeat Zimbabwe. A washout in the Ireland-Zimbabwe match would eliminate Australia, as Zimbabwe would advance with a draw.  Australia must win their final game and rely on other results, facing an early exit if Zimbabwe secures even a single point.

title: After Salman Khan, Aayush Sharma rushes to hospital to visit father-in-law Salim Khan
content: Salim Khan, Salim-Javed legend, admitted to Lilavati Hospital. Salman Khan left Madh Island shoot; Aayush Sharma's viral video shows him hurrying to father-in-law. Family including Alvira, Arpita spotted. 90-year-old icon, father of Salman, Arbaaz, Sohail; shaped Bollywood hits like 'Sholay'.

title: Taylor Swift won’t headline Super Bowl LXI halftime show despite fan hopes
content: Taylor Swift is unlikely to perform at the Super Bowl halftime show next year, not because of lack of interest but due to Jay-Z’s evolving vision. After Bad Bunny’s hugely successful performance, Roc Nation is prioritizing bold, culture shaping acts over guaranteed ratings. Swift’s personal ties to Travis Kelce and his uncertain playing future also complicate matters. While Swift remains one of the biggest stars in the world, the halftime show is now driven by impact and artistic statement as much as popularity.

title: The top 10 women's college basketball games left in the regular season
content: the 2025-26 women's college basketball season is now a two-week sprint to decide regular-season champions and conference tournament positioning . south Carolina has done most of its heavy lifting with a 3-0 SEC record against LSU , Texas and Vanderbilt .

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: Qualification round up next
content: the top four seeds -- Canada, United States, Slovakia and Finland -- have clinched byes through to the quarterfinals . the qualifying round matchups Tuesday are no. 5 Switzerland vs. no. 12 Italy (the winner faces Finland) no. 7 France (the winners faces Slovakia), no. 8 Czechia and no. 9 Denmark . Greg Wyshynski breaks down the men's hockey team's potential path .

content: the UEFA Champions League playoff round kicks off this week . the defending champs of both the Eredivisie and Serie A didn't make the playoffs . they were eliminated from the league phase, as were two clubs from LaLiga .

content: the 2026 men's hockey tournament has been thoroughly entertaining from start to finish . there is no other tournament where the best players are available to represent their countries with so much on the line . not every nation participated in last year's 4 Nations face-off .

content: it has been only a week since Super Bowl LX . it's already time for NFL teams to start thinking about offseason trades . 'the bill is a mock trade,' says one of the juiciest trade proposals .

title: What we learned at NBA All-Star Weekend
content: team Stars defeated team Stripes in the NBA All-Star championship . the weekend was already one of the more impactful in recent league history . here are four of the biggest storylines that emerged from Los Angeles . click here for all the latest from the NBA all-Star game .

title: 'War room set up': Vaishnaw apologises for 'issues' at AI Impact Summit
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Best portal addition for each team
content: the 2025 season offered the ultimate proof that elite portal recruiting can put a program in national championship contention . the offseason transfer window has officially closed with more than 3,200 FBS scholarship players making moves in January . here's a look at the key portal pickups to know for each Way-too-Early Top 25 team .

title: Buster Olney ranks MLB's top 10 relievers -- and there's no doubt about who's No. 1
content: coach Buster Olney ranked the best relievers in his 2026 season preview . he will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the team had checked in with the Athletics on Mason Miller's availability in the mid-2024 season .

title: College football had an incredible season. Remember how we got here
content: the Indiana Hoosiers raise the program's first football national championship trophy . college football has never been as fantastic as it is right now . the sport's blue bloods can still dominate, but new brands can compete for the ultimate prize .

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: spring has sprung early for baseball fans . we'll try to channel the anxieties of the discerning fan by looking at one outstanding offseason question each franchise seemingly left unanswered . how big of this need to go unaddressed?

title: 📈 Men's NCAA Tournament Bubble Watch
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . teams have roughly four weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections .

title: Kerala Science-IT Park foundation stone laid in Kannur
content: The project, with an investment of ₹600 crore on 50 acres, aims to leverage the State’s skilled workforce and biodiversity-rich Western Ghats to attract global scientists and companies.

title: Rahul Gandhi vetoed Sonia offer to make me CM in 2014: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Then Congress president had asked him to decide on a date for his swearing-in after 58 party MLAs supported him two years before the Assembly election, Assam CM and former Congress leader says

title: Mysuru: Defective silencers seized by city police crushed under road roller
content: The city police say the defective silencers that had been confiscated during the inspections conducted last month were ‘legally destroyed’.

title: Police arrest seven in three cases, recover property worth ₹26 lakh
content: The arrests have been made in connection with robbery and house burglary cases in the University and Ashok Nagar police limits

title: Government is not bearing expenses of foreign trip taken by Congress legislators, says Yathindra
content: The Congress MLC says there is no reason to object to the trip since the legislators are paying for it themselves, adding that he understands it to be a study tour.

title: Additional 3.48 lakh hectares under irrigation, says M.R.K. Panneerselvam
content: Presenting the T.N. Interim Agriculture Budget, the Minister says two lakh new free electricity connections have been provided to farmers over the past five years, with the government sanctioning ₹33,904 crore towards meeting the cost of providing free power to 23.86 lakh agricultural service connections

title: Karnataka Minister Mahadevappa’s ‘dog’ remark sparks row; loyal Congress leaders are not street dogs, says D.K. Suresh
content: A staunch Congressman is like a dog that remembers the debt of its owner and pays it back: D.K. Suresh

title: Armed men posing as cops loot cash, gold from realtor’s house in broad daylight
content: The incident occurred when 53-year-old Hombale Gowda was at home with his wife, Mangalamma and their two-and-a-half-year-old grandson

title: ‘We Help’ telecounselling service launched for students
content: The service can be used to share concerns and clear doubts of students appearing for SSLC and higher secondary examinations, and alleviate their stress as well as that experienced by their parents

title: To aid safe migration, Kerala to take pre-departure orientation to campuses
content: Kerala govt.’s NoRKA-Roots is set to reach out to prospective emigrants among students and the wider community

title: Retired BMTC employee clubbed to death over property row, son arrested
content: An initial probe revealed that Munikrishnappa had executed a will transferring some properties to his grandchildren, which is suspected to have intensified tensions within the family

title: Sunetra Pawar, NCP leaders meet Maharashtra CM, seek CBI probe into Ajit Pawar plane crash
content: Senior NCP leader Sunil Tatkare says Devendra Fadnavis assured that the State govt. will communicate with the Union Home Ministry in this regard

title: Telangana Govt focusses on amenities in GHMC ahead of elections to the Corporation
content: CM asks officials to explore setting up skywalks in areas with high traffic density, warns of suspension if roads are not clean

title: 194 Bangladeshi nationals deported from Meghalaya since 2021
content: Meghalaya Deputy Chief Minister Prestone Tynsong outlines multi-layered mechanism—including 18 check posts, entry gates, and a land customs station along vulnerable stretches of the State’s border with Assam and Bangladesh—to check infiltration.

title: Watch: Machattu Mamangam in Kerala showcases grand Kuthirakolam procession
content: Machattu Mamangam 2026 was celebrated on February 17 at Thiruvanikkavu Bhagavathy Temple in Thrissur, Kerala, drawing thousands to witness the iconic Kuthirakolam procession.

title: India aims to build consensus to harness AI for public good, contain harms: Vaishnaw
content: The government is constantly endeavouring to provide high-quality resources to startups, researchers and students, he said

title: NCP(SP) Pathanamthitta district committee disbands, joins Kerala Congress
content: Holding that the organisational uncertainty at the national level was also reflected at the State level, District president Jiji Vattasseril also claimed that the party lacked internal democracy and respect for district-level leadership.

title: Assam environmental activist flags rat-hole coal mining along Arunachal border
content: In a memorandum to Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, he suggested upgrading five reserved forests in the coal belt to wildlife sanctuaries.

title: Indo-French partnership a force for global stability, says PM
content: Shoring up defence cooperation and enhancing bilateral engagement in the critical technology sector are priority areas for both governments to take forward the ties

title: EC a ‘Tughlaqi Commission’ run by a political party, targeting people like terrorists: Mamata
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said the Election Commission was ‘defying’ Supreme Court orders and ‘targeting voters and undermining democracy’

title: Even after full term in power, DMK failed to fulfil promises: Vasan
content: Over the last five years, the DMK government has increased the financial burden on the people, says TMC(M) leader

title: Assam Government tables interim Budget for 2026-27; flagship schemes to continue
content: Tabling her last Budget before the State goes to polls, Ajanta Neog said Assam is, at present, the fastest-growing State in India as per the RBI data

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly session to end on February 20
content: The last session of the incumbent DMK government began on February 17, 2026 while the State is set to go to polls this summer

title: Culture, business, tech, defence on mind, France’s Macron begins his three-day India visit
content: French President Emmanuel Macron surprises Mumbai with a morning jog along South Mumbai’s promenade — Marine Drive

title: A budget interwoven with wise sayings
content: The Interim Budget presented by Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu featured couplets from the Tirukkural, verses from Sangam poetry, quotations from B.R. Ambedkar, and lines from Kahlil Gibran

title: Rahul Mamkootathil faces increased legal jeopardy after a second survivor deposes before magistrate
content: The magistrate recorded her statement in camera and under section 83 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita. Officials said the SIT probing multiple rape charges against the Palakkad legislator was poised to move the court for the survivor’s statement.

title: Tamil Nadu Interim Budget | Centre ‘artificially precipitating’ fiscal crisis in State: Thangam Thennarasu
content: While presenting the Interim Budget for 2026-27 in the Assembly, Mr. Thennarasu said the GST rate rationalisation was approved by the GST Council without considering the apprehensions recorded by several States

title: Bill Gates applauds tech-driven governance in Andhra Pradesh
content: The visit underscores Andhra Pradesh’s push towards becoming a leading technology-driven State, with RTGS positioned as a model for real-time, responsive governance

title: 51 Kuki students evacuated from school in Manipur’s Ukhrul
content: Exam centres for 18 of these students appearing for Class 10 and Class 12 board exams also shifted to the Kangpokpi JNV, according to officials

title: Machattu Mamangam: when the parched fields come alive with motif horses, drums and uncontainable human spirit
content: Raw energy, rhythmic beats and towering motif horses turn Thiruvanikkavu into a living canvas of tradition in Thrissur in Kerala

title: Political leaders, high constitutional functionaries must foster fraternity, live up to constitutional values, ethos: Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court Justices emphasise the urgent need for political accountability and restraint in public statements, warning against the normalisation of divisive rhetoric by high-ranking officials

title: Photographer held for ₹55-lakh house burglary at Whitefield in Bengaluru, 348 grams of gold valuables recovered
content: Police Commissioner Seemant Kumar Singh advised residents not to leave house keys in shoe racks or window ledges, warning that such practices render homes vulnerable to theft

title: Six Gujarat courts get bomb threat mails; nothing suspicious found so far
content: As per the officials, the courts in Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Valsad, Rajkot, Gandhinagar and Mehsana received the threat emails

title: Seven more Chairperson posts take Congress tally to 93, indirect elections to 3 Telangana Municipalities postponed
content: Model Code of Conduct is lifted, Telangana State Election Commission announced on February 17, 2026 afternoon

title: Tirupati researcher shows AI can help detect cervical cancer early
content: The system is reportedly able to identify morphological patterns indicative of a tumour even before it becomes ‘clinically detectable’

title: TDB appoints task force to ‘rectify anomalies’ in Global Ayyappa Sangamam audit report
content: TDB president K. Jayakumar says board had ‘erred’ in not answering auditor’s queries in entirety, thus inadvertently creating room for scepticism

title: Anganwadi workers continue protest for 15th day in Chennai demanding regularisation
content: Anganwadi teachers note that they are severely overworked and have neither received a pay increase nor been regularised

title: No anti-incumbency, LDF will return to power for third term in Kerala: Minister Sivankutty
content: The Minister claimed that even agencies engaged by the Congress had reportedly found no anti-government mood among the public.

title: Fresh, clean, local: Chennai’s cattle sheds become the new milk hotspots
content: Chennai’s mornings are changing, as more residents line up at Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) cattle shelters for fresh, unadulterated milk straight from the source. With 17 shelters across the city, the initiative is drawing steady demand not only for the quality of milk but also for the safer, cleaner environment it’s helping create on city streets.

title: Lottery favours Congress in Jangaon and Thorrur Municipalities
content: The outcomes added to the ruling party’s tally in the ongoing indirect elections to Municipality leadership posts. The process in both towns unfolded amid tense political circumstances.

title: Setback to Kerala govt as HC quashes LDF’s Nava Kerala Citizen Response Programme
content: PIL had alleged Kerala govt was misusing public funds to conduct the door-to-door survey ahead of Assembly elections. High Court says it finds sufficient cause to direct government to keep in abeyance all steps and proceedings initiated

title: ‘North feels fear, South instils hope’: Farooq Abdullah makes emotional appeal for unity against ‘fascist forces’
content: “This is supposed to be a federal country where States have their powers, and the Centre has its powers. But today the Centre controls everything, even stepping into areas meant for States,” he said

title: Hyderabad CP warns of strict action after video shows youths flaunting drugs before deity
content: Sharing the video on X, the Police Commissioner urged youth not to jeopardise their future for fleeting social media fame and said drug-related offences would not be taken lightly and that strict legal action would follow against those responsible.

title: Plea in Madras High Court insists I-T dept probe into Ramanathapuram MP Navas Kani’s assets
content: Chief Justice’s Bench orders notice, returnable by a week, to the Director General of Income Tax (Investigation)

title: Tamil Nadu Interim Budget: 16th Finance Commission report a disappointment, says Thangam Thennarasu
content: “It is disappointing to see that our serious concern toward the increasing levy of cesses and surcharges has not found place in the Commission’s recommendations,” he said in the Assembly

title: India's AI Summit opening in New Delhi marred by long queues, confusion
content: India’s AI Impact Summit, an event meant to showcase the country’s ​technology ambitions, faced a wave of online criticism on its opening ‌day on Monday

title: India's permanent contribution to world community’s agenda is of enormous importance to us: Antonio Guterres
content: To a question on India’s role at the U.N., Antonio Guterres said "first of all, we have a huge debt of gratitude to India” for its presence in U.N. Peacekeeping

title: Indore water contamination: Cong MLAs protest with bottles of ‘contaminated’ water in MP Assembly complex
content: Congress leader said that despite several deaths, the government has avoided a discussion on this issue in the Assembly, which is contrary to democratic values

title: Why Kerala declared tidal flooding a State-specific disaster | Explained
content: Decision comes in response to recurrent flooding from rising sea levels, especially during full and new moons, which has resulted in loss of life and property in low-lying areas. Victims will now receive financial assistance similar to that for other natural disasters

title: Karnataka High Court quashes BJP’s defamation case against Rahul Gandhi
content: The case was filed for allegedly issuing ‘defamatory’ advertisements in mainstream newspapers against the then BJP government during the campaign for the State Legislative Assembly elections in 2023

title: 24 of 44 public sector undertakings in J&K loss-making, four non-functional: govt to Assembly
content: "Strengthening and revival of sick or loss-making PSUs, including measures related to infrastructure and manpower, are being examined by the respective administrative departments to improve their operational and financial performance," the deputy Chief Minister said.

title: Economics will give way to politics and security in how nations make choices, Jaishankar says
content: Jaishankar said the world is witnessing the weaponisation of production, finance, leveraging of market shares and tightening of export controls

title: Kerala on the cusp of new development chapter under Vision 2031, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: CM says Kerala govt will initiate follow-up action on the three-day ‘Vision 2031’ conference recommendations, including legislative measures where necessary

title: Tamil Nadu Interim Budget: Government’s outstanding debt expected to increase to ₹10.71 lakh crore
content: Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu, while presenting the Interim Budget 2026-27, pointed to a lack of cooperation from the Union government toward the State

title: Watch: CBSE Board Exams 2026 begin amid excitement and nervousness across India
content: The CBSE Class 10 and 12 board exams have begun today, with over 46 lakh students appearing nationwide. Students arrived at their exam centres with a mix of excitement and nervousness, while parents offered last-minute advice and support

title: Free power to handlooms, power-looms to be rolled out from April 1 in Andhra Pradesh
content: Andhra Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav said the scheme will provide 200 units of free power per month to handloom weavers and 500 units to power-loom units

title: Kalithimbam tribal hamlet in Erode gets bus service
content: In the absence of a bus facility, students faced hardship while traversing the forest stretch and had sought the introduction of at least two services — one in the morning and another in the evening

title: Baramati plane crash: AAIB seeks specialised support to retrieve data from cockpit voice recorder
content: Requesting all stakeholders to avoid speculation, AAIB said it was diligently following all prescribed technical and procedural protocols to ensure a comprehensive, objective and evidence-based investigation.

title: Watch: Sachin Pilot slams LDF’s “Lost Decade” in Kerala
content: Senior Congress leader Sachin Pilot critiques the Left Democratic Front’s decade-long rule in Kerala, highlighting migration, fiscal distress, and corruption.

title: Madras High Court refuses to extend time granted to actor Vishal for depositing ₹10 crore
content: Justices C.V. Karthikeyan and K. Kumaresh Babu hold that his application filed on December 18, 2025 seeking eight weeks time has become infructuous

title: Repatriate 'gangster' Kumar Pillai to Hong Kong: Court; cites acquittal in extradition cases
content: A Supreme Court ruling has made it clear that in the absence of permission from the extraditing country, the applicant cannot be tried in India for any other pending cases.

title: HRD Minister Nara Lokesh congratulates JEE Mains toppers from Andhra Pradesh
content: “It is a matter of great pride that students from Andhra Pradesh have showcased their talent at the national level in the JEE Mains results,” Nara Lokesh posted on X

title: Supreme Court rules out murder by strangulation in 2002 Telugu actor death case
content: A Bench of Justices Manoj Misra and Manmohan said there was “overwhelming” ocular and medical evidence of poisoning

title: Bengaluru’s Kempegowda International Airport shipped 60 million rose stems in 2026 Valentine’s season, 38% year-on-year increase in volume and 64% rise in tonnage
content: International shipments remained steady at 305 MT with Singapore emerging as the top overseas destination, followed by Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), Abu Dhabi (UAE), New York (US), and Kuwait

title: Actor Jayaram appears before ED for questioning in Sabarimala gold case
content: Jayaram has been asked to appear for questioning in the wake of his association and reported financial transactions with Unnikrishnan Potti, prime accused in the case

title: Indore MBA student's classmate abused her body after killing; performed witchcraft: Police
content: “The woman’s body was found in her classmate's rented house,” Deputy Commissioner of Police Shrikrishna Lalchandani said

title: HYDRAA receives complaints on fire hazards and encroachments during Prajavani
content: HYDRAA Commissioner A.V. Ranganath reviewed all 59 petitions and assigned them to the respective officials for redressal

title: Unemployed youths line up in Kolkata to avail State’s  ₹1,500 Aid
content: West Bengal’s Banglar Yuva Sathi scheme, offering Rs 1,500 monthly allowance to unemployed youths aged 21–40, has drawn massive response. Enrollment camps are underway from February 15–26, 10 am to 5 pm

title: Mohali schools receive bomb threat emails, Fortis Hospital also mentioned
content: "The bomb threat to schools also mentioned the Fortis Hospital in Mohali, where we conducted anti-sabotage checks. Non-essential services were kept on hold while essential services continued," a senior police official said in Mohali
